intro: Lippia elliptica, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open areas and is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers. Lippia elliptica is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
